website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive pick for families wanting a fun, rounded, single-rope swing that's easy to install.
pros: The basic design is a lot of fun for youngsters
Plastic disk is reasonably durable and weather-resistant
Can accommodate kids weighing up to 100 pounds
cons: Seat is on the small side and not ideal for larger kids

customer_reviews.title: Versatile! We added it to our Lifetime Geometric Dome Climber
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy we got this swing. We added it to our Lifetime Geometric Dome Climber just to give the kids a bit more to do when they're outside. They use it so much more than the dome itself. It's like a mini theme park/fair ride for them when swing in circles... skimming by the bars of the dome. Lots of fun! I know because both their grandma and myself have taken this baby for a spin! 😂 Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Anne V.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Make sure your homeowners insurance is up-to-date
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Make sure your homeowners insurance is up-to-date. We hung this in our front yard and regularly found strangers (adults and children) using it. We had to move it to the backyard and thus far, no idiots have jumped the fence to use it. To summerize, this swing is fun enough to openly trespass on to someone else's property in order to get a turn. However, it is not so fun that you would be willing to both trespass AND scale an eight foot fence to use.
customer_reviews.author: rishylars

customer_reviews.title: Loves it, but beware rope burn
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES his disc swing. He is 8 now and still holds his weight. Rope is strong. He did get rope burn the first few times so I purchased some plumbing Styrofoam that you wrap around pipes and it sticks to itself. That works really well to protect his hands and it was like 3 bucks at the local hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Chasity

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for 2 weeks set up and so far nothing to complain about aside from rainwater collecting inside of it, but that only requires tipping it to its side to drain the water out. I imagine it could become a problem if you dont empty it out and its not used for a while. Seems sturdy and will likely last a while. Starting to leave reviews simply because I got annoyed with all of the fake and paid for reviews while buying my stuff on Amazon. Getting to the point you cant trust any reviews...
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Fills with water and ink rubs off
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our play dome. Easy to install and the kids love it. However, the seat fills with water every time it rains and must be emptied. Major design flaw for a swing that is meant to be outside. Also, after just one week, the red and blue ink from the “little tikes” logo started rubbing off onto my kids’ legs and clothing. I would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: amanda1680

customer_reviews.title: My kids love love love this
customer_reviews.text: My kids can't stop fighting over this. I got it to add a second swing to my backyard tire swing thinking two kids and two swings would be a win win. Not true at all. My kids love love love this. It is the first thing they run to. The first thing the "call" when they start putting shoes on. The first thing they fight over. While that part of it would earn it 1 star, I can't deny that my children loved this and played with it non-stop all summer, seriously they never got tired of it, unlike other things in our yard. Great toy.
customer_reviews.author: MommySarah

customer_reviews.title: Good swing.
customer_reviews.text: We bought it for our daughter but all the kids in neighborhood is enjoying it even if the park is 5 minutes away . I had to stop some of them bcz is not for big kids or adults:(:(. It was hard to install it bcz the tree is tall and not on even ground. If we’ll move we’ll have to buy a new one bcz we can’t take it down anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Swing has been a hit with the granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: Our 4 year old granddaughter has enjoyed this swing. She can play on it by herself or get pushed by someone. I like that there is a plastic guard where the rope goes into the disc part of the seat. This helps to protect little legs from getting chaffed by the rope. We have it hanging in a tree. Overall, very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Hoov

customer_reviews.title: Perfect swing!
customer_reviews.text: This swing accompanies us every summer when we camp. We don't have any place to hang it around our house, but it gets so much use when we camp. It's simple and sturdy, and puts up with a lot of abuse from a lot of kids! Everyone loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Water Intrusion
customer_reviews.text: When it rains, water gets into the plastic seat (not just on top), and you really can't get it out. If you turn it upside down to pour the water out, the first few feet of rope get wet. Very disappointing. Otherwise it is OK. Holds my kids but in place as she swings, so it achieves its primary function.
customer_reviews.author: Ironsides

customer_reviews.title: Nice seat- Poor rope
customer_reviews.text: The swing seat is good- very easy to set up and use. The rope is pretty cheap and we ended up taking it apart and using a different - better quality rope. Changing the rope was easy to do but not necessary if it's somewhat of a short/strong branch. It shipped fast and was brand new- no issues with damage or anything. The only thing that (besides the rope) we dislike is if it rains a lot or hard water does get into it after a while which made for a few wet butts before we realized it. Overall good- cheap but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice swing for little kids
customer_reviews.text: The kids like this and it works well. Standing on it is difficult for the little ones, sitting is the most stable. I would recommend that you get a carabineer to secure it to a structure. It has been out in the weather and is still in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Chojnacki

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy to last
customer_reviews.text: This is a joy for us. It was a little hard to hang up high enough on our huge maple tree, but I figured out a way to push the cord loop higher on the limb I chose by using a yardstick. Pretty simple. The kids (age 3 and 5) love it. We started by holding the little one while she was swinging, but she caught on about holding the cord tightly so she is now on her own. It's simple and fun. No batteries required!
customer_reviews.author: Gary H. Labowitz

customer_reviews.title: Attractive to all ages and very durable
customer_reviews.text: This swing is currently being enjoyed by children ages 2-12. It was easy to attach to the tree and the knot on the bottom makes it easy to adjust the height off the ground without having to get a ladder. So far it's taken a lot of punishment (and given very little back) and is no worse for wear even with daily use. In order to avoid tearing of the rope on the branch, we slipped the rope through plastic tubing. I expect this swing we still be around after my children have all grown up.
customer_reviews.author: MWM

customer_reviews.title: Great but accumulates rain water.
customer_reviews.text: We love this attached to our climbing dome. Only thing I don’t like is that it has holes on top but not on bottom so when it rains it gets water in it that doesn’t drain and gets the kids bottoms wet when they go sit on it unless we turn it upside down and shake all the water out. I wonder if drilling a hole on the bottom would help but haven’t tried it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: They absolutely love it! They play on the dome (monkey bars) ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought the disc swing and installed it on our dome we had previously bought for our grandkids. They absolutely love it! They play on the dome (monkey bars) and swing every day. We had previously bought blowup houses for them and they developed leaks, just didn't hold up. The dome and swing will last longer than their interest, I'm sure! Another great product.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Leech

customer_reviews.title: 4yr old's favorite outdoor toy! Wish the rope was longer.
customer_reviews.text: Wondering how much wear the rope will take up around the tree limb. Wish the rope was longer. My 4 year old has absolutely loved this swing since we put it up. She doesn't use it standing yet, but I think she will when she is a little older and is bored of using it traditionally - or when she gains some more confidence. Highly recommend if you have a sturdy branch reasonable in height and don't mind the ground under swing to be worn. Good alternative to the traditional swing!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Investment: Tough as Nails
customer_reviews.text: Update: Breeds mosquitoes; drill some drain holes in the bottom of it. Mine was somehow collecting water inside. This little thing has paid for itself 10 times over. Even my 13 yo was caught playing on it, likely trying to break it but he couldn't. He's 120 lbs. My 10 yo twins wear themselves out on it. Sometimes they just sit on it and twirl. We hung it from a tree branch in the yard, they tore the ground up so we bought some astro turf so they could keep going without getting filthy after it rains.
customer_reviews.author: Techno-Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love this swing
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy a tire swing, but when I saw the prices, I bulked. I saw this little guy and thought it might serve the purpose for less money. I totally underestimated how much fun this could be. I've had children from ages 3 to 13 play on this for hours and love it. The little kids don't ride it, but they love to throw it and watch it swing on the tree. I hang it high in the tree and the older kids love to try to climb up the rope and work on swinging themselves. It's provided hours and hours of outdoor joy!
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: We Love it!! parents included
customer_reviews.text: If you have a tree, this swing is a must!!! The best $20 I spent hands down. The first day my kids played 5 hours on it without coming to ask me for anything. Not to mention the swing is a hit among the neighborhood kids, they all come and swing on it. I've had 3 kids pile on top of it and it is still holding out nicely. I've purchased it two months ago and they still love it and go on it few hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: Island girl

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My kids (ages 5 and 8) LOVe this swing! We attached it to our lifetime dome climber and they play with the swing more than the dome. Very easy to connect and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Winder

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to go into the dome I bought...which I already thought was super fun. However, I hooked this little thing up and my nephews (3 & 6) loved it! They would swing on and off of it for hours. Glad I purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Stricker

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy swing
customer_reviews.text: This is a good swing. Rope held a 100lb person with no issue and the disc is a hard plastic. Only complaint is the top of disc is smooth and can be slippery when younger children try the swing.
customer_reviews.author: calicamper

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: This works great! We use a metal clip to secure it around our tree branch, then take it down when we go inside so we don't worry about kids getting hurt when we're not around (front yard). The rope does fray a bit with use, but that is to be expected. Our kids have lots of fun on this! Even our oldest, who's 12. It's an easy and inexpensive way to add a swing to your life if you have a tree or something strong from which to hang it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Probably need to pressure wash the seat to get the caked on dirt but other than that this has been a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased thise in 2014 and they still are working and looking decent! Probably need to pressure wash the seat to get the caked on dirt but other than that this has been a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good for budget gifting!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 7 year old boy’s birthday, to add to their new swing set. They love it. The 7 year old and his 5 year old brother were on it together! Best feature: durability (as expected because of fantastic brand)
customer_reviews.author: Peach

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SWING.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 5 1/2 year old little girl. She is rough and tumble too. She LOVES it. We just wrapped it around a big branch on the tree outside. She runs to it each day when we get home from school... and swings. She is crazy about it. The seat is hard so if you are throwing it around the branch to wrap it.. around the tree.. make sure it does not fall back down and bonk you in the head (lol) like I did. Ow!! Really nice and not expensive and we got it fast!!!
customer_reviews.author: VJ

customer_reviews.title: lots of fun, easy to hang
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves this. It was easy to mount using the instructions. No hardware needed. He does need to be pushed on it. He can't pump himself like he can on a two rope or chain swing. This is Little Tikes so it's good quality, but for some reason they did not put holes in the bottom. It is hollow and fills with water every time it rains. The rain travels down the rope, and the swing needs to be held upside down to empty it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy little swing....about the size of a frisbee.
customer_reviews.text: My kids loves swings and they especially love this. It is nice because they can swing anyway they like. I like the fact that it came with a rope unlike a lot of other swings like these. The base is about the size of a standard Frisbee. It is sturdy just like everything else Little Tikes makes.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: this worked out better than i thought
customer_reviews.text: this worked out better than i thought. the grands stand on the stairs to the tree house and swing way out on it. they love that they can spin on it too. cheap entertainment when you have a large tree. we used one of those adjustable woven plastic straps with carabiners to hang over the branch and attach to the swing
customer_reviews.author: kit

customer_reviews.title: Disc is small, rope too short
customer_reviews.text: Second time ordering. New review: $2 more and at least 2 foot less rope. You can't hang the swing from any tree branch of decent height. You need the height to get a decent swing. Why they shortened the rope I'll never understand. (Old review: Plenty of rope to hang as high or low as you want. It does fill with water when it rains, so beware. Disc is a bit small but holds me (I'm 48) and my 10 yr old with no problem. Might want to wrap the rope in heavy tape or rubber so hands don't get rope burn.)
customer_reviews.author: CaringConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Little Tikes Disc Swing
customer_reviews.text: We hung this in our backyard from a large oak tree. I bought it for my 3 grandkids to play on (ages 2-4). Well the disc isn't very wide, and they have very hard time trying to stay seated on the disc. This has really been a MAJOR DUD. Maybe if the disc had been wider, but it's just too darn hard to stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine E. Siggins

customer_reviews.title: The kids love it, just feeling like tarzan if you attach ...
customer_reviews.text: The kids love it, just feeling like tarzan if you attach it high and use the full lenght of the rope. Don t attach the rope directly to a branch if you use a tree like mee, it will cause damage to the branch and rope. But a few iches of a hose stripped over the rope where you attach it will protect the rope and the tree.
customer_reviews.author: Lennartsell

customer_reviews.title: Fills with water with every rain.
customer_reviews.text: Fills with water with every rain. Terrible design. Kids can barely stay on it.
customer_reviews.author: Meli

customer_reviews.title: great swing. good construction and the included rope is ...
customer_reviews.text: great swing. good construction and the included rope is quite long. my 5 year old loves it! Update 12/15 - took off one star as its construction allows water to get inside the swing whenever it rains. this water doesn't appear to drain until someone swings on it and it often ends up spraying out on to that person. Might be solved by drilling a small drain hole.
customer_reviews.author: efm

customer_reviews.title: Nice little swing
customer_reviews.text: My 6 and 4 year olds love this little swing. There are only two problem with it: they can't pump on it so always need someone to push them and it does fill up with water, so they sometimes get wet. They'll turn it upside down and let the water drain out, but they sometimes forget.
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST swing, and best value!
customer_reviews.text: We've gone through many swings through the years of raising eight children. This is the favorite outdoor swing among all the kids, hands-down, and for less than $20! Our only complaint is that the rope doesn't last as long as we would like. You can go to a hardware store and buy a better quality rope. When ready to buy a higher-end swing (made for both adults and children), check out Max's Hammock Chairs for indoor or outdoor use, around $100 and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: jaylake

customer_reviews.title: Great kids swing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to use with his Gorilla Gym in the Winter months, and we can take it outside later. He loves it! Durable, and the rope is nice and long for when we hang it from a tree.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Great for sitting and standing
customer_reviews.text: This came in the mail very quickly and was actually bigger than we expected it to be. The disc is wide enough to sit or stand on. My children love playing on it in our front yard. It only comes with the rope attached so if you want a stronger hold I recommend getting the extra gear to hang it up with
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlynn

customer_reviews.title: Good swing. Only issue is water getting inside after it rains.
customer_reviews.text: My 5 yr old daughter loves this swing. We hung it from a tree in our backyard and it gets a lot of use! My only complaint is that when it rains, a bit of water gets inside. You can hear it sloshing around in there and when I swing her sometimes it will drip out onto her or me. Otherwise, this swing is very durable and lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: L. K.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely ove this swing! Most importantly, so do the kids!! They can go really high and have never fallen off!👍
customer_reviews.author: sweet Leilani

customer_reviews.title: This swing doesn't stand up to the elements
customer_reviews.text: I'm not real happy with this swing. It works fine, but there's two major inconveniences: 1) Water collects inside the disk and won't evaporate, meaning you have to turn it upside down and shake the water out each time it rains. And 2) after two years of sun exposure, the rope has become frayed and brittle, releasing a handful of small fibers and dust every time you grip it.
customer_reviews.author: bwjones

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright
customer_reviews.text: The rope is like grabbing razor blades. The seat is too small for anyone over 8.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle, Taylor

customer_reviews.title: 3 and 5 year old love it
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it. They have to use a stool to jump onto this while swinging. Looks fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great fun for my 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: great fun for my 3 year old. Now she's 4 and still likes it. The rope is getting worn and I will have to change it soon, my only problem is that the rope is a little harsh on their hands. But a great toy for the age
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Good fun toy for picnics at the park
customer_reviews.text: Bought after a friend brought one to a picnic party at the park. Kids had lots of fun with it and so did adults. Gotta but a linger rope to attach to it though.
customer_reviews.author: Faz

customer_reviews.title: It's a disc swing!  The kid loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves this disc swing. It gets hot in the summer, but that's to be expected when you live in a place where the temps pass triple digits by the time June rolls around. Outside of that this thing is AWESOME. The rope is tough and sturdy, installation was SIMPLE, and I know my kid is going to use this for years.
customer_reviews.author: GAKS10

customer_reviews.title: hours of fun for the great grand kids
customer_reviews.text: A BIG bang for your bucks. This is unit # 2 for us. The last one was in service 6 years before the poly rope became too frayed. The kids never tire of using it.
customer_reviews.author: carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids at least 3 yoa
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Safe for children. This swing is better suited for children at least 3 years old. My child is 18 months old and is not heavy enough to balance the swing. Does get water inside the "shell" of the seat. Comes out easily by shaking it upside down.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Best $30 Ever Spent on my Kids
customer_reviews.text: Yep. 5 stars. Easy to install (and I had my doubts, I'm not a knot person and this was easy). Only a little tricky to get the height right but still super easy. My 3 year old loves this swing and has been on it non stop. I foresee many years of this swing paying for itself.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Not for small kids
customer_reviews.text: Actually it is well built product, it should provide a lot of fun. I bought it for my 2 year and 2 months old daughter. She is 93cm tall and 33 pounds. She was very scared on this swing because it swings to every direction and very hard to control for her. I knocked out one star is because I didn't know it was not for small kid. Product itself is very well built.
customer_reviews.author: sn2002bt

customer_reviews.title: Nice disc swing but it collects water.
customer_reviews.text: This is my granddaughters favorite swing now. Instructions were great. I have it attached to a tree limb. My only beef and why I am removing one star, is that it collects water after it rains. So it's always a good idea to flip it over to check for and drain water before use. I may just end up drilling a few drain holes in the bottom of it
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for my 5 year old to swing on
customer_reviews.text: I bought my kids the Lifetime Geometric Climbing Dome for Christmas and hung this from the middle. It is perfect for my 5 year old to swing on. My 2 year old still has some difficulty, but will get the hang of it eventually. I like that it has a couple of holes in it so water won't sit on it if it rains. I imagine countless hours of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Julia L. Izzolo

customer_reviews.title: Fills with rain water, rope unwinds.
customer_reviews.text: The seat FILLS with water when it rains, but the rope also unwinds from the kids weight and slowly drops in height, eventually dragging on the ground. Plus the rope comes bound with a loop at the top that is not adjustable without cutting the rope, which then frays. So unless your tree is exactly the right height, you'll probably need more rope anyway.
customer_reviews.author: 3eagles

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Rope hurts your hands, very rough, easy rope burns. The seat collects water and once swinging side to side gets your pants all wet if you don't try to shake it out.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great classic swing! We have it hanging in a tree and my son and other kids coming over love it. My three year old daughter can't quite use it yet, but she doesn't mind too much. It does fill up with water when it rains, so we just tip it over. Drilling a hole in the bottom would solve this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Famlife

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This works great in a Lifetime playground Geo Dome. We have this "set" in the backyard and the kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: jkrispies

customer_reviews.title: I would buy a better one
customer_reviews.text: One part is my fault, didn't read it was meant for a tree...but, we did get it to work on the swingset, and it is difficult for a child to get on unless it is really low. There isn't a lot of room on it also for their little bums also. My daughter was 4 when we got it, she never liked it.
customer_reviews.author: HESS_NC

customer_reviews.title: Holds water.
customer_reviews.text: Only flaw is that water gets inside the seat through the rope hole. It is always full of water and gets your pants wet when you swing.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Fun swing
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this swing. It has been used a ton since we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Lopez

customer_reviews.title: My children absolutely love this swing
customer_reviews.text: My children absolutely love this swing. It is definitely a favorite among the yard toys. It is sturdy and has held up well. My children are 9 and 6 years old. Very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these 20 years ago for my daughter. It finally broke so I'm ordering another for my grandson. Hopefully, it'll last just as long.
customer_reviews.author: Millsmom5

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it. The swing itself can handle a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it. The swing itself can handle a lot of weigh and tracks pretty straight. Make sure you buy the correct rope to attach it to a tree limb or other high point. The rope you buy should be able to support plenty of weight.
customer_reviews.author: REcap

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, best thing I ever bought for the grand kids... use them with the Stansport Hammock Tree Straps so that the tree does not get damaged. Very sturdy and a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Sleasman

customer_reviews.title: Good but need hardware to hang
customer_reviews.text: Works great but doesn’t come with any hardware to hang it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy H.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I am disappointed that after using it for a few days on a pine tree that the string is fraying quite a bit, but I guess that is the nature of the design. My four boys love it and I appreciate the length of the rope. We take it camping, it makes a nice activity for the boys when us adults are resting at the campsite.
customer_reviews.author: H. Lee

customer_reviews.title: We love this!
customer_reviews.text: Great swing, but ours came with a busted rope, so we had to replace that part with our own heavy duty nylon rope, and knot it real well. I can't however express the simple joy this little disc swing has brought our kids and other neighborhood kids! It's a great alternative to a typical style swing.
customer_reviews.author: K Rene Ross

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson received this for Christmas. He will be 3 in April, and he loves to swing. This one is great! You can't beat Little Tikes, and this one is great when you don't have room for a regular swing set. This swing is especially great for kids with sensory disintegration issues. It's a good way to burn off excess energy, too.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Just use with common sense and they'll have a great time!
customer_reviews.text: Our house is a hit with this thing. It is slightly dangerous if you get nailed with swing after falling off. My daughter almost broke her nose (the seat is very hard plastic). Just use with common sense and they'll have a great time!
customer_reviews.author: Brett H.

customer_reviews.title: Kids will love it.
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter enjoyed a disc swing as a child, so we bought this for her children. Loved the easy to follow hanging instructions and the center "extension" seems to prevent the chafing of the thighs that was always a minor issue with plain, flat discs. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JAL

customer_reviews.title: I like this swing
customer_reviews.text: I like this swing, it is cute and looks adorable hanging in our front yard. It is not a good swing for younger kids. Our 4 year old can balance ok but gets nervous and our 2 year old is not old enough to figure out how not to fall backwards yet! The reason I gave it only 3 stars is because there are 3 little holes underneath the swing in the bottom and it seems to be perfect breeding ground for spiders! I guess they crawl down the rope and hang out in the holes, pretty much every day we find a new spider in there and clean it out.
customer_reviews.author: Alyce

customer_reviews.title: Just what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a nice light, comfortable disc swing to setup as a tree swing for our kids to use as they get older. This was a nicely priced swing that has worked great so far. We have had the swing up for a few months now and not only does our daughter love it, the other kids in the neighborhood love it too. The only problem is that when it rains the swing collects water inside (must run down the rope which goes through the center). It drains easily enough though.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: It's the most fun swing ever for my 4 and 5 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: It's the most fun swing ever for my 4 and 5 year old boys! We have it on a high branch in our yard, it goes too the Moon, boys cant have enough! I recommend this highly. I should take pictures but its so fun I don't have time! :)
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Need a tree
customer_reviews.text: Give some thought to where this will go. My granddaughter's garden has many trees from which this swings happily with her on it. However, my grandson's yard has no trees so it sits in the closet awaiting a tree to grow (I guess). If you have a tree, the child will love it - it's a big hit.
customer_reviews.author: Readerrover

customer_reviews.title: Both our 6 and 2 year old love this swing -- we may actually be ordering a ...
customer_reviews.text: Both our 6 and 2 year old love this swing -- we may actually be ordering a second one since they fight over it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome swing, wish I could ride it!
customer_reviews.text: Just hung this up on a tree out back. Can't wait for the Grandkids to come over and give it a spin. the directions are easy to follow, and you don't need any other parts to hang the swing. Do make sure the branch you select is sturdy enough for the kids!
customer_reviews.author: NPR MANTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and exactly as advertised. I had to get an extension to make it longer. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Lentzj

customer_reviews.title: Rain water collects in the seat
customer_reviews.text: Swing is good, easy installation. The issue I have though is that water collects in the seat when it rains. It should have drain holes in the bottom or something. I'm not a fan of mold :(
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, fun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to add to the geo-dome we purchased, the kids love this swing.
customer_reviews.author: svsutej

customer_reviews.title: Definitely highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I chose this over other brands because the plastic comes up in the center a few inches, covering the rope. This prevents rope burns if they are wearing shorts. It also makes the swing straighter & more stabe. The best part is that it was cheaper than all other brands including what is in the local stores!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and fun
customer_reviews.text: We added this swing to the center of our climbing dome and the kids love it. Seems sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Stykel

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this swing
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this swing! It is quite comfortable to swing on. It states a weight limit, but we changed rope to a more superior rope and the whole family swings, including mom and dad! If using the rope that comes with it, I think you would still be safe, just keep a check on it ever so often. Fun, fun, fun!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne  Vick

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy product. Disc is smaller than I thought it would be. Otherwise has held up well
customer_reviews.author: BB_Koru

customer_reviews.title: Nice little swing, economical, safe.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't really matter if I like it. The kid likes it, and that's what counts. Comes with a VERY long rope, so you could put it up high on a tree over a pond. I wrapped it around the top of the swing set for the 4 year old, and that's all we need until she gets bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Castorag

customer_reviews.title: We used it in a Tree near the house And they use it pretty
customer_reviews.text: My kids have been enjoying the disc swing. We used it in a Tree near the house And they use it pretty often
customer_reviews.author: FN

customer_reviews.title: My kids love this swing
customer_reviews.text: Nice swing. Only negative is that water gets inside after the rain. But it is not difficult to get out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Kids love this!
customer_reviews.text: The day I put this up on the playground everybody remarked about it and noticed it. The kids who use it have already had a lot of fun with it! It was easy to hang and the height was very adjustable by wrapping the rope around the swingset bar. Every kid should try one of these!
customer_reviews.author: R.C. White

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids of all ages!
customer_reviews.text: My kids begged me for this after using one at a friends house. I have older nieces/nephews aged 9-11 and my kids, ages 3-6, all love it. Easy to hang, very durable, hardest part was finding a tree with a sturdy branch. I've also seen this at Target for a few bucks cheaper, but Amazon's price seems fair and well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described. Had to tie it up to ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Had to tie it up to our swing set because I hadn't paid attention to the connection, but the provided rope is plenty long for that. 4yo daughter figured it out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: JQM

customer_reviews.title: A classic swing at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: My kids had swings like this when they were little, so I wanted to find one for my grandson. It was half what others are priced and was a steal at $19.99. This kind of swing takes some getting used to. My 3-year-old grandson will have to grow into it. He doesn't have adequate arm strength to hold on yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sara in Syracuse

customer_reviews.title: Just a swinging
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to hang from a patio 4"x4" and my 6 year old granddaughter loves it. Only problem is that she almost gets blisters from gripping the yellow "rope" and she refuses to wear fingerless gloves to safely grip, so time will tell a simple solution.
customer_reviews.author: dMarie

customer_reviews.title: Still hanging & stable after a year and a half ...
customer_reviews.text: Still hanging & stable after a year and a half! The yellow rope does stretch a little, but you can adjust with use if that's important to you.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi M

customer_reviews.title: what you see is what you get-it's great!
customer_reviews.text: Our kids, friends' kids, and grand kids, ages 2-10 love it! Glad we didn't go with a more expensive one, cause this is absolutely fine. Wouldn't know, what more money can get you, this is great.
customer_reviews.author: eLISAbeth Kleen

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun
customer_reviews.text: My kids love swing g from our climbing dome i this swing. Both my 3 and 4 year olds love it. Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little swing
customer_reviews.text: This swing has provided hours and hours of entertainment daily for my youngest (6). We don't even have a big tree for it, it doesn't take up much room.
customer_reviews.author: AmazinMom4

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best swing we got our grandkids, they love it. Easy to set up. Worth the value.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Paumen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for my 5 year old and his friends. Huge hit.
customer_reviews.author: agol

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: They actually had one of these setup in the tumbling class I take my 2 year old to and I had to drag her off it. I went home, read the reviews, and ordered one to put on her swing set outside. It was easy to setup and she was very excited to see she had one of her own. Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne S

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: My 7 1/2 year old grandson has already out grown his swing set. Not enough of a challenge any more I guess. We hung this from Grandpa's tree and it's a big hit. Brings some adventure and spontaneousness. How old should a child be to use it? When you stop holding your heart when they get on it they're ready.
customer_reviews.author: LadyofArgonne

customer_reviews.title: This swing seems great, but is not suitable for a three year ...
customer_reviews.text: This swing seems great, but is not suitable for a three year old! My son kept falling backward on it, I think because his legs were long enough to hang off the front and balance the weight of his bum. Anyway, probably great for a +3 kid, even though the packaging says ages 3-10.
customer_reviews.author: emily a nisch

product_meta.title: Little Tikes Disc Swing Displayer
product_meta.description:
About Little Tikes founded in 1970, the Little Tikes company is a multi-national manufacturer and marketer of high-quality, innovative children's products. They manufacture a wide variety of product categories for young children, including infant toys, popular sports, play trucks, ride-on toys, sandboxes, activity gyms and climbers, slides, pre-school development, role-play toys, creative Arts, and juvenile furniture. Their products are known for providing durable, imaginative, and active fun.In November of 2006, Little Tikes became a part of MGA entertainment. Mga entertainment is a leader in the revolution of family entertainment. Little Tikes services the United States from its headquarters and manufacturing facility in Hudson, Ohio, but also operates several manufacturing and distribution centers in Europe and Asia. Durable plastic seat construction. Includes 10-foot rope. Rope is weather resistant. Recommended for ages 3-10 years. Dimensions: 11.75L x 11.75W x 5.25H inches.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Hang this classic swing from any tree branch for hours of fun.
feature_bullets: Classic plastic disc rope swing can be hung from any tree branch to provide hours of swinging fun
Molded plastic neck helps protect child's leg from rope
Includes 10 feet of rope to accommodate different tree heights

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars667 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
